did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Smyth County (Va.) List of Free Negroes in the Northern District, 1859.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Smyth County (Va.) List of Free Negroes in the Northern District, 1859. Local government records collection, Smyth County Court Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Va. 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items came to the Library of Virginia in a transfer of court papers from Smyth County.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Smyth County was named in 1843 for Alexander Smyth, a former congressman from Virginia who had died in 1830 while efforts were underway to create the new county. The county was formed from Washington and Wythe Counties.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Smyth County (Va.) List of Free Negroes in the Northern District, 1859. The list was compiled by the Commissioner of the Revenue for tax purposes. It documents the name, gender, age, and occupation of 38 free African Americans living in the Northern District of Smyth County in 1859.

controlaccess.head: Genre and Form Terms:
controlaccess.genreform: Free negro and slave records--Virginia--Smyth County.
